corpus.description: Wall Street Journal Texts from the PropBank Project
corpus.name: PropBank

sentence.text: He finally resigned himself to memorizing the translated words , hoping to come across a matching entry on one of the invoices .
Read through your full speech several times , preferably aloud and preferably into a tape-recorder , but do not try to memorise it word for word .
Anatoly made no notes , but memorised every word Jean-Pierre said .
This duty might vary according to the nature of the contract of employment but would be broken if the employee copied or deliberately memorized a list of customers .
In large hotels it would be impossible for staff to memorise all the names of the guests and their room numbers .
He may also consciously memorise client 's names and their particular requirements .
DMITRY 'S FATHER HAD A GLOBE , and he would point out to Dmitry the different countries and continents , and would make young Dmitry memorise the names of their capital cities .
` Memorize those names , addresses and numbers .
Grace Bird , who had the smallest part in the play , that of Maud Mockridge the lady novelist , had still not memorised her lines and read from the script .
Not quite so confidently as in Stratford ; or in Oxford , of course , where he had memorised whole sentences from the Jan Morris guide .
There was a number on the pad ; she tried to memorise it but a large hand was placed squarely on the pad .
Almost as though he 's trying to memorise what I look like , thought Juliet , knowing she could never forget his brown eyes and curling eyelashes , and the smile that hovered on his lips .
Each night I try to memorize a spot of Dante .
Being a Freemason , he had to memorize a great deal of material , and he did this with TL in his do-it-yourself SAS study .
Students in the having mode of existence will â€¦ write down every word in their looseleaf notebook so that later on , they can memorise their notes and thus pass an examination .
He memorized pages of it just because he loved it and often recited his favourite bits to himself on those inevitable odd moments of waiting about in queues and so on .
Instead I memorized the answers , made quick notes as soon as I could , and later wrote the whole interview in my field diary .
That you 're not sort of , Oh just I 'll memorize this lot .
Ringers memorize patterns of changes , known as `` methods , '' which have odd-sounding names like Kent Treble Bob Major or Grandsire Caters .
